required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Individualization of Antineoplastic Drugs and Anti-Infective Drug in Children With Hematoplastic Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Dose Individualization of Antineoplastic Drugs and Anti-Infective Drug in Children With Hematoplastic Disease

collaborator.agency: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators' purpose was to assess the feasibility of dosage individualization of the commonly used antineoplastic drugs and anti-infective drugs in children with hematoplastic disease.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators' purpose was to assess the feasibility of dosage individualization of the commonly used antineoplastic drugs and anti-infective drugs based on the opportunistic sampling strategy in children with confirmed or suspected hematological neoplasms.

primary_outcome.measure: change of plasma concentration of bortezomib
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of bortezomib after administration

primary_outcome.measure: change of plasma concentration of eltrombopag
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of eltrombopag after administration

primary_outcome.measure: change of plasma concentration of imatinib
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of imatinib after administration

primary_outcome.measure: change of plasma concentration of dasatinib
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of dasatinib after administration

primary_outcome.measure: change of plasma concentration of pegaspargase
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of pegaspargase after administration

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 14 days
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentrations of anti-infective drug after administration

arm_group.description: Bortezomib;eltrombopag;imatinib;dasatinib, pegaspargase and anti-infective drugs administered at standard dose for children with hematological neoplasms.

intervention.description: bortezomib was administered follow the doctor's advice.
eltrombopag was administered follow the doctor's advice.
imatinib was administered follow the doctor's advice.
dasatinib was administered follow the doctor's advice.
pegaspargase was administered follow the doctor's advice.
anti-infective drugs was administered follow the doctor's advice.

intervention.intervention_name: PEGylated Recombinant Human Granulocyte Colony-Stimulating Factor
intervention.description: pegaspargase was administered follow the doctor's advice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be diagnosed with hematological neoplasms
- Antineoplastic drugs or anti-infective drugs used as part of regular treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- expected survival time less than the treatment cycle;
- patients with other factors that researcher considers unsuitable for inclusion.

facility.name: State Key Laboratory of Experimental Haematology, Department of Paediatric Haematology, Institute of Haematology and Blood Diseases Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor; Head of department of clinical pharmacy and pharmacology
